MovieLine: Tell Baker that I told him all that I know already.
Tell him I want to live in peace, understand?
That it's no use to go on tormenting me!
I know nothing at all about that case of coins.
But if he'd listened to me, we could have avoided this altogether.
I went to the Army court.
I can't tell Baker what happened to the money.
Go back and tell him that!
Word's around you had a visitor...
Maybe Baker would like to know just what you and Jackson had to say...
That's not what I'm being paid for.
I'm only interested in what name Jackson's hiding under now!
Why do you think Jackson may be assuming another name?
I would have found him already.
When I start off to find somebody, I find them.
What does he pay you for murdering me?
That's what he calls himself now.
He said quite a bit that should interest you...
...and one or two things that interested me.
The name Jackson's hiding under is...
He also mentioned somethin' about a certain...
...cash box which just happened to disappear.
Well, you don't have to worry.
He'll never say anything to anybody again!
You did a good job for me.
I think his idea was that I kill you.
But you know, the pity is, when I'm paid...
It won't do you any good.
You know that you have a face beautiful enough to be worth $2,000?
But you don't look like the one who will collect it.
Hijo de puta que te pariŽ!
I hope you end up in a graveyard...
...with the cholera, and the rabies, and the plague!
Cut me loose! Cut me loose, you filthy bastard!
I hope your mother ends up in a two-dollar whorehouse!
Cut me loose! Cut me loose!
Let me go, and I'll pardon you.
I feel sick. The blood is rushing...
You swine! You son of a bitch!
You're brave with a man who's tied up!
One bastard goes in, another comes out.
Cut it out! Cut it out!
I'm an honest farmer! I'm innocent of any--
Who says so? You can't even read.
Roll it up. Roll it up!
I'll give you a good idea where you can put it.
To hell with all you sheriffs and deputies and all who gave birth to you!
Hey, everybody, look! Look! He's giving him the filthy money!
But you won't enjoy any of that money, not a penny.
If there's justice, that money will go to the undertakers!
Every penny of it. You know who you are?
You want to know whose son you are?
You don't, I do. Everybody does.
You're the son of a thousand fathers!
Your mother, it's better not to talk of her. I never hurt anybody!
...the condemned is found guilty of the crimes of murder, armed robbery...
...of citizens, state banks, and post offices...
...the theft of sacred objects, arson in a state prison...
...perjury, bigamy, deserting his wife and children...
...passing counterfeit money, and contrary to the laws of this state...
Therefore, according to the powers vested in us...
...we sentence the accused here before us...
...and any other aliases he might have...
...to hang by the neck until dead.
May God have mercy on his soul. Proceed!
Know how much you're worth now?
There are two kinds of people in the world, my friend.
Those with a rope around their neck...
...and the people who have the job of doing the cutting.
Listen, the neck at the end of the rope is mine!
So, the next time, I want more than half!
You may run the risks, my friend, but...
If we cut down my percentage...
But if you miss, you had better miss very well.
Whoever double-crosses me and leaves me alive...
Wanted in 15 counties of this state...
...the condemned, standing before us... sitting before us...
...has been found guilty by the Third District Circuit Court...
...of the following crimes: murder, assaulting a justice of the peace...
...raping a virgin of the white race...
...and statutory rape of a minor of the black race...
...of derailing a train in order to rob the passengers...
If you ask me, it seems like a book!
An armed unit, escorting a cash box of gold coins, meets a Yankee ambush...
...and only three of them are saved.
The thing that wasn't saved, though, was the coins.
But then the Army decides, of course, it ought to hold a hearing...
He disappears, and becomes Bill Carson.
But you don't know just who you're lookin' for, and I do!
And when he's found, I'd be scared to be put in his shoes!
Where is Carson? - All I know is Carson re-enlisted.
The poor guy's minus an eye.
He lives with a girl called Maria, who'll tell you.
She's a fresh young whore in the territory.
Now, what's the name of that town'? It's someplace very near...
Glad they got him. A man guilty of all those crimes!
People with ropes around their necks don't always hang.
Even a filthy beggar like that has a protecting angel.
A golden-haired angel watches over him.
Of all these crimes, the accused has made a full, spontaneous confession.
Therefore, we condemn him to be hung by the neck until dead.
May the Lord have mercy on his soul. Proceed.
Let's get the hell out of here!
What are you saying? Anybody can miss a shot?
Nobody misses when I'm at the end of the rope!
You never had a rope around your neck. Well, I'm going to tell you something.
When that rope starts to pull tight, you can feel the devil bite your ass!
...there's really not too much future with a sawed-off runt like you.
'Cause I don't think you'll ever be worth more than $3,000.
I mean, our partnership is untied.
I'll keep the money, and you can have the rope.
You filthy, double-crossing bastard! Of all the stinking, dirty tricks--
The way back to town is only 70 miles.
If you save your breath, I feel a man like you could manage it.
Come here! Cut this rope off! Get off that horse!
Get off that horse! You filthy coward!
...I'll rip your heart out and eat it!
I'll skin you alive! I'll hang you up by your tongue.
I'll kill you! I'll kill you!
I'll kill you! I'll kill you!
Such ingratitude, after all the times I've saved your life.
What do you want with me?
Go on talking about Bill Carson.
You were calling to him in the dark!
I don't know where he is.
He packed his things ten days ago, and went away with his unit.
That's all I know. I swear!
I'm very sorry, but the store is closing.
Here's where I keep the best ones.
- You wanna try the pistol, just step-- - Let's go.
This morning I heard the whole thing.
They say Colonel Canby's closing in with his Northerners...
...and no later than tomorrow that they'll be in the city.
That's why these Southerners are getting out!
You see, as soon as these cowards hear there are blue shirts around, they run.
- These rebels have no will to fight! - Poor things.
We get rid of these bastards...
...then we begin making money on those Yankees.
They carry gold, not paper dollars. And they're going to beat the South.
Look, see that one with the white beard sitting in the wagon?
General Sibley. He looks dead. He's finally getting out of our hair.
Hooray for Dixie! Hooray, hooray for Dixie!
Where's the owner of that horse?
The war has frightened me already.
I'm looking for the owner of that horse.
He's tall, blond, he smokes a cigar, and he's a pig!
You leave him be! He doesn't know who rides every horse!
You rotten criminals, how dare you?!
There are two kinds of spurs, my friend.
Those that come in by the door...
...and those that come in by the window.
Even when Judas hanged himself, there was a storm, too.
Cannon fire or storm, it's all the same to you!
You ever see this before, my friend?
Throw it over the roof beam.
Now, make sure the rope is tight!
It's got to hold the weight of a pig!
Now, put the rope around your neck!
It's too big for your neck?
I shoot the legs off the stool!
...guilty of the following crimes: horse theft...
I don't know. As soon as I hit the desert, I'm thirsty.
They say people with fair skin can't take too much.
Like that, you won't have to carry so much.
Another 100 miles of beautiful sunbaked sand.
Even the armies are afraid to march through there.
Sibley's men are retreating up there.
...but no one will set foot in this hell...
One hundred miles. That's a nice walk.
What was it you told me the last time?
If you save your breath, I feel a man like you could manage it.
And if you won't manage it, you'll die.
Come on, Blondie, we don't have very far to go. Only 70 miles.
Only eight and a half hours more before sunset.
$200,000 in gold. It's yours. Just get me water!
My name is Jackson. Not Carson.
Yeah, yeah, glad to meet you, Carson.
I'm Lincoln's grandfather. What was that you said about the dollars?
I hid the gold. The gold is safe!
Have a name? Have a number?
You talk first, eh'? I'll give you the water later!
But it must have a name or a number on it.
Don't die! I'll get you water!
Stay there. Don't move, I'll get you water.
If you do that, you'll always be poor.
Just like the greasy rat that you are.
Please don't die. Please! I'm your friend!
I'll help you. I'll help you!
Don't move. I'll be right back. I'll get the water.
Don't drink! It's no good for you.
Blondie, what's the matter? Please don't die!
I've got a very sick man here.
But we have no more beds here.
He is away at the moment.
He should be back any day now.
It doesn't matter. For the moment, we'll take very good care of my friend.
In case you didn't know it...
...God is on our side, too. Because He hates the Yanks.
All right, put a fresh bandage on him.
Out, soldier. Out you go, come on.
Look out for him, please. He's like a brother to me!
Father, did he speak'? Did he say anything'?
Did he ask for me? Did he speak about anything?
No, he hasn't spoken as yet. But you mustn't worry.
He's both young and strong. That's what's kept him going until now.
He should regain his strength in a very short time.
Thank you, Father. You don't know how much this boy's life means to me!
The old Father tells me you'll be up and around in a few days.
You're very lucky to have me so close when it happened.
Think, if you'd been on your own.
...it's good to have somebody close by, friends or relations.
You're all alone, huh? Like me, Blondie.
We're all alone in the world.
I have you, you have me.
Only for a little while, I mean.
What a dirty rotten trick of fate!
We could have all that money in our hands.
I must tell you the truth, Blondie.
In my place, you would do the same thing.
It's all over for you now.
There's nothing anyone can do anymore.
I'll tell you one thing, Blondie. If I knew that my last hour had come...
...I swear, in my place, in your place, I would do the same thing.
I would tell about the gold. Yes, yes I would!
I would tell the name on the grave.
After all, what good is the money to you if you're dead?
I know the name of the cemetery.
But you know how many graves there are there?
Coffee? Please tell me the name.
If I get my hands on the $200,000.
I swear it! I'll always honor your memory!
But if I get that name from you, I'll give you water!
All right, you dirty skunk, get your ass off the bed!
Come on, come on, the party's over.
The wagon is all ready to go.
From the way the wounded are pouring into this place...
...we better get the hell out of here before we get caught up in the war.
This is something I have to look into. It'll only take a minute. Get moving.
I don't know the right thing!
I was just passing by here. I said to myself...
...I wonder if my brother remembers his brother.
It doesn't matter. I'm very happy.
Yeah, well, I'm very glad I came.
Oh, my uniform. It's a long story.
Let's talk about you. It's more important.
Only now do you think of them?
Our mother has been dead a long time now.
Our father died only a few days ago.
He asked for you to be there.
Outside of evil, what else have you managed to do?
It seems to me you once had a wife someplace.
One here, one there, wherever I found them.
Go on, preach me a sermon, Pablo.
Just keep on the way you're going.
The Lord have mercy on your soul.
I'll go, I'll go. While I'm waiting for the Lord to remember me...
...l, Tuco Ramirez, brother of Brother Ramirez...
You think you're better than I am.
Where we came from, if one did not want to die of poverty...
...one became a priest or a bandit!
You chose your way, I chose mine.
You talk of our mother and father.
You remember when you left to become a priest.
I must have been ten, twelve. I don't remember which, but I stayed.
I tried, but it was no good.
Now I am going to tell you something.
You became a priest because you were...
...too much of a coward to do what I do!
I didn't tell you my brother was in charge here.
My brother, he says to me: "Stay, brother, don't go home."
Here, there's plenty to eat and drink. Bring your friend, too.
Whenever we see each other, he never lets me go.
My brother, he's crazy about me.
Even a tramp like me, no matter what happens...
...I know there's a brother somewhere who will never refuse me a bowl of soup.
Well, after a meal, there's nothing like a good cigar.
They're gray like us. Let's say "hello" to them and then get going.
Hurrah for General... what's his name?
God is with us because He hates the Yanks, too!
God is not on our side 'cause He hates idiots also.
Hey, Blondie, isn't that Angel Eyes?
All right, what's he doing? Sleeping?!
Yeah, and you better be Bill Carson.
I like big fat men like you.
When they fall, they make more noise.
And sometimes they never get up.
The captain wants to see you right away.
Be sure these two get good treatment.
Hey, Blondie, did you hear that? Good treatment!
...I want the prisoners treated as prisoners.
There's hundreds of prisoners out there and only a few men to guard them.
What am I supposed to do? I have to have respect!
I think that you'll manage to gain their respect by treating them better!
Are our men treated that well in Andersonville Camp?
I don't give a goddamn what they do in Andersonville!
While I'm in charge here, the prisoners are not to be...
Sergeant, gangrene is eating my leg away...
I know the prisoners here are being robbed systematically.
I know there's scum around, or bivouacked near the camp, waiting...
But as long as I'm commandant, I won't permit any such trickery!
Just as long as you're the commandant.
I know this leg means I won't last very long...
...but I pray I can manage to have enough time...
...to amass evidence and bring to a court-martial all those who discredit...
You and the others better lay low for a few days.
I'll keep this. You go. Wallace will let you know.
Angel Eyes said for us to lay low for a few days.
But we'll keep close enough to keep an eye on things.
I knew it, I knew it!
The minute I saw you, I said to myself:
Look at that pig, Angel Eyes...
...I'll bet he's got himself an easy job!
And he never forgets a friend!
I never forget old friends, Tuco.
It's good to see old friends again.
Especially when they come from so far away...
...and have so much to talk about.
And you do have a lot to talk about, haven't you?
If you were with Sibley, then you were...
Was it hard crossing the desert?
Especially if you don't have anything to drink.
Why are you going under the name of Bill Carson, now?
One name is as good as another.
Not wise to use your own name.
Like you, I bet they don't call you Angel Eyes.
Like a little music with your meal, Tuco?
Yes, very good for the digestion.
Bill Carson's a fake name, huh?
Bill Carson's name is written on it.
Was Carson dead or alive when you found him?
What'd he tell you about the money?
I don't know what you're talking about!
You can sure consider yourself much luckier than your pal.
Wallace will punch your friend as long as the song goes.
So many of us have had a session in there.
I have nothing to tell you!
What did he say about the money?
...he knows the name of the grave.
I know the name of the cemetery now...
...and you know the name of the grave.
You're not going to give me the same treatment?
Not that you are any tougher than Tuco...
...but you're smart enough to know that talking won't save you.
You changed partners, but you still got the same deal.
I'm not greedy. I'm only taking half.
It should make it easier than just one.
Hey, Corporal, afraid he'll get lost'? Where's the Rebel going?
To hell with a rope around his neck and a price on his head.
That's a lot of money for a head.
I bet they didn't even pay you a penny for your arm.
I told you once, but if I ever get you down...
...you're gonna need a lot of help to get up again.
You're a lot luckier than that one there.
You get some proper rope, and you're all finished.
And there isn't any partner, this time, to shoot you down.
Sure would like to put your paw on it, huh?
I would like to piss, it's rough.
I've been shaken up in this train nearly ten hours now.
You smell like a pig already!
Let's try not to make things any worse.
I can't while you're watching me.
You made a lot of noise my friend, huh?
You don't wanna break our friendship, huh?
Clemens, take care of the horses.
I've been looking for you for eight months!
Whenever I should have had a gun in my right hand...
Now I find you in exactly the position that suits me.
I had lots of time to learn how to shoot with my left.
When you have to shoot, shoot! Don't talk.
Every gun makes its own tune...
Just a minute. I'll be right there.
Just give me a little time to get dressed, and I'll open up.
Put your drawers on, and take your gun off.
How the hell did you get out of that pigsty?
My own way. I'm here with your old friend Angel Eyes.
You talked, you traitor! You talked!
If I did, I probably wouldn't be here, now.
So, only you know your half of the secret?
I'm very happy you are working with me!
I'll get dressed, I kill him, and be right back.
He's not alone. There's five of 'em.
So, that's why you came to Tuco.
It doesn't matter. I'll kill them all!
They shot him at close range.
The other one will be along.
You back there. Come on, let's go!
Were you going to die alone?
There should be a bridge across that river.
I got a good sense of where I'm going.
Tuco has taken you this far, I will take you all the way...
We found them near the perimeter, sir.
Your reason for being around here?
You'd better learn to distinguish rank.
It sure as hell might be you today, so go write your will.
You got to take a test to prove it.
You've got a career. At the least, I'd say you'll make colonel!
Like it says in the manual.
You've got every qualification to become expert in the use of weapons.
This is the most potent weapon in war!
The fighting spirit is in this bottle!
Yes, because soon you can join the gallant heroes of Branston Bridge.
We have two attacks a day. Two attacks a day?
The Reb's have decided that damn bridge is the key to this whole area.
And headquarters has declared that we must take that ridiculous flyspeck...
...even if all of us are killed.
Otherwise, the key'll get rusty and just be a spot on the wall.
Both sides want the bridge intact!
Intact is how the South wants it. And we want it intact, too.
You'll all turn to dust, but one thing is sure, boys...
...to speak the way I do to volunteers?
I've done it. I've blown it up...
It's a court-martial offense to imagine-- to dream of blowing it up.
Even to think of destroying that bridge is just...
Why not really blow it up, captain?
Yeah, captain, it's nothing. Let's scare the hell out of them!
I've even worked out a plan.
The best time is after the attack...
...when there's a truce to get the wounded.
...I could save many thousands of men.
But what I lack is the guts.
They're beginning the daily slaughter, right on time.
Captain! All companies are awaiting your orders.
It looks like the captain is really asking for a bullet in his guts!
I've never seen so many men wasted so badly.
I've a feeling it's really gonna be a good long battle.
The money is on the other side of the river.
Amigo, I said on the other side. That's enough.
But while the Confederates are there, we can't get across.
What would happen if somebody were to blow up that bridge?
Then these idiots would go somewhere else to fight!
A little of this will help.
Take a slug of this, captain...
You realize we might be risking our lives?
If I get killed, you'll never get your hands on all that beautiful money.
It sure would be a pity.
Can you help me live a little more?
Why don't we tell each other our half of the secret?
No, I think it's better that...
The name of the cemetery is...
The name on the grave is...
It'd be a lot easier with that.
Two can dig a lot quicker than one.
If you shoot me, you won't see a cent of that money.
We're gonna have to earn it.
I'll write the name on the bottom of this stone.
You pig! You wanted to get me killed? When'd you unload it?
You see, in this world there's two kinds of people, my friend...
...those with loaded guns, and those who dig.
You see, that's what Bill Carson told me:
There's a grave marked 'unknown', right beside Arch Stanton.
It's money! It's all ours, Blondie!
You're joking, Blondie. You wouldn't... you wouldn't play a joke on me like that.
It's no joke. It's a rope, Tuco.
I want you to stand up there, and put your head in that noose.
Just a dirty son of a...!
